thread.title: MAFS Anthony Manton bemoans lack of sex with 'bride' Nadia | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: MAFS Anthony Manton bemoans lack of sex with 'bride' Nadia | Daily Mail Online

author: Candice Jackson
title: MAFS Anthony Manton bemoans lack of sex with 'bride' Nadia | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 440 shares While the comment is meant to take place in a piece-to-camera, the issue may come out in a later commitment ceremony with the pair. During a commitment ceremony last week, Anthony said: As far as I'm concerned, Nadia's mine' - to which fans called him out for being 'arrogant' and 'controlling.' 'As far as I'm concerned, Nadia's mine': In a commitment ceremony last week, Anthony claimed ownership of Nadia, and this week he's due to voice his displeasure over intimacy issues with his new flight attendant 'wife' The antics of Anthony and other stars of the show, have skyrocketed the show to become Nine's top-rating reality series, with the Channel confirming it will be renewed for a fifth season. Married At First Sight has averaged at more than 1.3 million viewers during each night of the season for far. Nine’s Head of Content, Production and Development, Adrian Swift, told The Daily Telegraph: 'We are so proud of Married at First Sight and its performance. It is a terrific show that is emotionally charged, full of love, and provides couples with a real shot at finding love. It’s no wonder everyone is talking about it. We can’t wait to see what the next series will bring.' Saying I DO again! Channel Nine have confirmed their top-rating reality show will be renewed for a fifth season to air in 2018 Meanwhile, the Sky Racing broadcaster appears to be receiving the biggest backlash from the show's growing viewers, which he fought during a phone interview with his TAB radio employers on Tuesday. The Daily Telegraph reported the furious 'husband' was frustrated with his portrayal on the show, labeling it far from the truth. He also ranted about how he believed a bad 30 second clip oh his blowing up with anger over losing the WiFi connection was strategically used to portray him in a certain light. Married At First Sight's Anthony Manton SLAMS his 'villain label' claiming anyone who thinks the show is real 'must still believe in the tooth fairy' Furious: On Tuesday night's episode, the 33-year-old was seen blowing up with anger after the WiFi went down in his apartment Complaining: He was seen making a furious call through to customer service to fix the problem Last week Anthony left Cheryl Maitland in tears at a dinner party, publicly berating her decision to stay in the house, saying she would look like a 'f***ing idiot' if her new relationship with Andrew didn't work out. 'Putting yourself into this position though, where you're having a second time round. You've gotta get it right,' Anthony said. Nadine later blasted her TV husband's take down of Cheryl, telling The Fix: 'It was awful to see that the guy I was committed to and married to was dishing it out.' Giving out: Last week Anthony left Cheryl in tears at a dinner party, publicly berating her decision to stay in the house He's left Nadia upset in the past after telling her to have more direction and re-pursue her career in the media. 'You probably should. You need to have a bit more direction. Head back down that track, I think,' Anthony said. 'It was awful': Nadine later blasted her TV husband's take down of Cheryl at the dinner party Anthony acknowledged he had become the show's villain, with News Corp Australia reporting him saying that reality shows always need a bad guy. 'In my case, there needs to be a villain in these shows, and I happen to be it on Married At First Sight,' he said. Knows it: Anthony acknowledged he had become the show's villain, with News Corp Australia reporting him saying reality shows always need a bad guy
